algorithm_technique: Iterate through intervals, add non-overlapping ones, merge overlapping ones with newInterval, then add remaining.
problem_summary_simple: Insert a new interval into a sorted list of non-overlapping intervals, merging if necessary.
problem_summary_technical: Merge overlapping intervals by iterating through a sorted list and combining with the new interval.
key_insights: The input `intervals` are sorted by start time, which is crucial for an efficient O(n) solution.
The algorithm can be broken down into three phases: adding intervals before the new one, merging overlapping intervals, and adding intervals after the merged one.
The merging logic involves updating the start and end of the `newInterval` to encompass all overlapping intervals.
